The Bryan Museum is introducing a lecture series that will help expand the narrative of Galveston and Texas history.

Join historian Sam Collins, III this Saturday, September 12, as he shares the life of John Rufus Gibson, a name everyone should know. Gibson dedicated his life to the education of youth on Galveston island. His career spanned over 50 years and the impact of his influence is still being felt today. The inspiring story of this man and his family have been hidden for years. It is time to reveal it and celebrate it!

Sign up for the Zoom presentation: https://thebryanmuseum.org/hidden-history/
